name: Acquire Product
description: Customer obtains a product to satisfy a need(s).

children.name: Identify Product Need
children.description: Identify and communicate customer needs.

children.name: Defined Requirement
children.description: Customer needs are defined, understood and communicated.

children.name: Propose Product
children.description: Propose and configure product that would meet the customer's needs per new or established agreement.

children.name: Proposed Options
children.description: Viable product options meeting customer needs are presented and understood.

children.name: Validate Eligibility
children.description: Validate customer is eligible to obtain proposed product configuration, pricing, etc.

children.name: 1) Customer profile established. 2) Product information current.
Eligible Customer
children.description: The customer is eligible for the product offered.

children.name: Eligible Product
children.description: The product is eligible to be delivered and/or deployed.

children.name: Accept Product
children.description: Accept the product based upon agreement.

children.name: Initiated Order
children.description: Good(s) or service(s) have been ordered.

children.name: Provide Product
children.description: Provide the product configured, priced and delivered per agreement.

children.name: Sourced Product
children.description: Product sourced per agreement to the customer.

children.name: Configured Product
children.description: Product configured per agreement to the customer.

children.name: Arrange Payment
children.description: Arrange payment for product per agreement.

children.name: Payment Directive
children.description: Payment arranged for purchased product per agreement with customer.

name: Commission Asset
description: Evaluating, acquiring, building, assembling, maintaining, and readying the asset for use to fill a need within an organization.

children.name: Submit Asset Request
children.description: The act of placing a request for installation or maintenance of an asset.

children.name: Asset request accepted
children.description: The request is received.

children.name: Validate Request
children.description: The act of authenticating, and verifying a request received for asset.

children.name: Asset request approved
children.description: The request is reviewed and approved for asset evaluation.

children.name: Evaluate Asset
children.description: The act of assessing performance, or suitability of asset.

children.name: Asset scope of work approved
children.description: The work needed to make the asset ready for use is approved.

children.name: Configure Asset
children.description: The act of acquiring, initializing, setting up, building, assembling, validating, disposing or repairing asset in preparation for deployment.

children.name: Asset ready for deployment
children.description: The asset has been tested and verified that it is ready for deployment.

children.name: Deploy Asset
children.description: The act of making the asset ready for use and closing the request.

children.name: Asset made available for use and request closed
Asset available for use
children.description: The asset is in commission and ready to be used by the operation/organization.

name: Deliver Solution
description: Implement organizational strategy through specific solution initiatives based on analysis of the business gaps / deficiencies and solution development.

children.name: Establish And Refine Business Strategy
children.description: Formalize and prioritize business objectives to achieve business strategy and address a business need. This includes performing an objective-driven business impact analysis using the business architecture models as a frame of reference.

children.name: Clearly Articulated Strategy
children.description: Organizational strategy is defined, assessed, and provides direction for global/ enterprise business planning and alignment.

children.name: Measurable Objectvies
children.description: Business Objective(s) that meet SMART criteria are created to realize business strategy and goals.

children.name: Defined Business Gaps
children.description: Well understood and articulated gap between current state challenges and the future state vision of the business in terms of value.

children.name: Research Market and Competitive Drivers
children.description: Research external drivers that could influence corporate strategy--market trends, competitors, emerging technology etc to identify areas that could impact the business.

children.name: Analyze Company Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats (SWOT)
children.description: Strengths and Weaknesses is an internal assessment of business capability vs threats and opportunities which are externally focused evaluations that could influence the company in identifying strategy to respond.

children.name: Assess Business Scenarios
children.description: Based on gathered internal and external information, the company identifies various scenarios that could occur to see if there is something that was not considered and should be addressed when creating strategy.

children.name: Define Strategic Goals
children.description: Create high level goals to provide direction for the company.

children.name: Define Objectives
children.description: Create specific, measurable, actionable, time-bound, and realistic targets for the company to achieve to meet the provided goals.

children.name: Prioritize Objectives
children.description: Determine the order of importance of the defined objectives in case limits in resources--time, people, or money--make it necessary to conduct trade-offs.

children.name: Perform Objective Gap Analysis
children.description: Identify current state versus future state in the business relative to the objective in order to determine the gap that must be bridged and any interim steps to do it. This includes identifying options for closing the business gap --what steps or tasks need to be done to make progress toward achieving the desired future state.

children.name: Communicate Strategies
children.description: Once the strategy has been defined, it is communicated through-out the organization for alignment and execution.

children.name: Facilitate Strategy Development
children.description: The strategy planner sets up and facilitates meetings, summarizes information and makes sure the strategy is developed in a manner that is useful.

children.name: Define Solution Options
children.description: Leverage business architecture, engineering and related business analysis and design disciplines to develop business solution options that address priority business objectives that close capability gaps to implement strategy.

children.name: Target State Solution Models
children.description: Current/Future State models with gap closure approach including core services, orchestrations, and processes modeled as needed.

children.name: Identified Capability Gap(s)
children.description: Current state challenges and future state vision are defined for each capability needed to meet the objective.

children.name: Identify Business Impacts
children.description: As initiatives are formed to target the company objectives, they are analyzed from the perspective of impacts to value streams/stages, capabilities, information and organization, as well as domains.

children.name: Identify Capability Gaps to meet Objectives
children.description: Capability gaps, dependencies and overlaps are identified based on the scope of the initiative.

children.name: Document Current State Architectures
children.description: The present state of architecture is identified and documented based on the scope of the initiative.

children.name: Define Future State Architectures
children.description: The desired future state of the architecture is defined and documented.

children.name: Model Current State Processes
children.description: Create a business process model which depicts the current state.

children.name: Model Future State Processes
children.description: Create a business process model which depicts the desired future state which addresses pain points in the current state.

children.name: Develop Architecture Options
children.description: Based on the gap between the current and future state of the architecture, options can be identified for bridging the gap and achieving the objective.

children.name: Create Solution Models
children.description: Solution Models are representations of the architecture to visibly communicate current and future state.

children.name: Obtain Approvals for Technology Exceptions
children.description: If a solution option requires new technology that is not in the accepted architecture for the organization, a request is made for an exception to add it, which then goes through an architectural review for approval.

children.name: T-Shirt Size Initiative Options
children.description: Determine where an initiative is on a scale from very large to small to get an initial estimate of size/complexity for development effort.

children.name: Verify Solution Feasibilities
children.description: Determine if a solution option is technically able to be implemented, partially based on current state, cost/complexity and dependencies.

children.name: Plan Solution
children.description: Establish and prioritize initiatives (epics in SAFe) based on solution options and related investments required to achieve business objectives

children.name: Strategically Aligned Initiatives
children.description: Strategically aligned initiatives identified, approved, funded and resourced. Resources are focused on most valuable initiatives.

children.name: Business Case
children.description: Initiative Business Case  (cost/benefit analysis with features and KPIs)

children.name: Initiative Plan
children.description: The initiative project plan (waterfall methodology) or agile roadmap is created with defined feature scope.

children.name: Develop Business Cases
children.description: A business case outlines the benefits and costs of an initiative to help prioritize it for implementation--could be LWBC for SAFe.

children.name: Approve and Prioritize Units of Work
children.description: The Portfolio Manager shephards epics through the Portfolio Kanban based on WIP to identify which should be prioritized to work by ARTs in the Portfolio. The Portfolio memebers use criteria to evaluate the relative importance of initiatives, epics, etc to select the ones that should be done first or assigned limited resources.

children.name: Assign Human Resources
children.description: Provide human resources (employees or contractors) to the initiative to develop and execute it. When needed team members are not available, it may be necessary to hire additional employees or obtain contractors to do the work--the actual hiring occurs in another VS, but identifying the number of people needed and the required skills would occur here.

children.name: Secure Solution Funding
children.description: Once an initiative is prioritized, funding is allocated for its development and deployment.

children.name: Identify Solution Overlaps, Gaps, Dependencies
children.description: Based on various initiatives that are either proposed or in development, determine if there are dependencies from one to another, overlaps in functionality, or potential gaps in capabilities that would prevent realization of the desired business value.

children.name: Develop Solution Plans and Roadmaps
children.description: Based on the scope of the initiative and any identified dependencies, the work for the features is sequenced for the purpose of directing what needs to be done. This includes identifying work that is technical or architectural in nature that must be done to enable the business functionality.

children.name: Plan Infrastructures
children.description: Create a plan for implementing the infrastructure, such as system architecture, needed to support the solution.

children.name: Develop Solution
children.description: Manage solution detailed design, development, testing and release planning.

children.name: Solution Release Plan
children.description: A plan that describes the solution components that will be released together or sequentially due to dependencies. This includes the communications, configuration, support, and resources required to implement the solution.

children.name: Solution
children.description: A well-designed and built Solution (combination of people, process(es), assets and technology) is successfully designed, developed, and tested to meet defined business need and customer expectations to close one or more capability gaps.

children.name: Manage Project Risks and Issues
children.description: Whether there are dependencies between teams working on the same initiative or on other teams on a different effort, planning has to occur to make sure schedules align to facilitate delivery of functionality. Identify potential problems that could impact the solution schedule, cost or scope and determine the probability, level of impact, and possible approaches to mitigate or prevent them. Identify any problems that are getting in the way of the team completing work effectively and resolve them or escalate as needed for resolution. As functionality is developed, the RTE, Project Manager, epic owner, and/or product manager keep track of and report progress towards completion of the release to management. Conduct inspect and adapt sessions periodically to identify areas for improvement and implement them.

children.name: Define and Prioritize Features
children.description: The Product Manager will break down an epic, with the epic owners assistance, into features to develop the solution. The features are prioritized based on WSJF and dependencies.

children.name: Define and Document Requirements
children.description: Identify the detailed functionality needed for the development and delivery of the solution (such as features, user stories, BRS, process/procedure steps, policy updates etc)

children.name: Define User Experiences
children.description: A UX designer conducts research with customers to determine the desired experience and functionality needed to provide value and solve a problem. Based on research create ficticious customer/users that exhibit traits and have similar needs typical of a market segment to identify a common solution approach. May also involve designing a prototype of a solution interface  for feedback to be used by an internal or external customer to address business needs.

children.name: Identify Minimum Viable Products (MVP)
children.description: Based on the solution's status after testing, readiness of the production environment, and any outstanding issues/tasks, determine if the solution is ready to be implemented.

children.name: Identify Technical Debt
children.description: As initiatives are formed to target the company objectives, they are analyzed from the perspective of impacts to value streams/stages, capabilities, information and organization, as well as domains.

children.name: Conduct Team Planning
children.description: Identify the features/stories or requirements that the team will develop for the next release and create a plan for how it will be achieved.

children.name: Procure Assets
children.description: Obtain any needed assets (hardware, software, equipment etc) needed to develop and/or deploy the solution.

children.name: Create Test Plans
children.description: Develop the approach, scenarios, and steps necessarily to validate that the solution meets requirements and does not have significant problems.

children.name: Conduct Proofs of Concept (POC)
children.description: Implement a solution in a limited fashion to determine the feasibility or fitness of the approach to solve the problem.

children.name: Prototype Solution Option
children.description: Create a version of the proposed solution--can be from low fidelity to an interactive version.

children.name: Program Solutions
children.description: Would be coding software as well as unit testing code to determine if there are any defects before checking it in and doing integration testing.

children.name: Create Data Sources
children.description: A DBA will set up the test, development and production databases in accordance with the selected architecture and make sure the data is available.

children.name: Establish Version and Release Strategies
children.description: Identify the steps, the schedule, and the resources for implementing the solution into the field for use by the customer or human resources. Develop the approach for implementing and managing the solution in development as well. For code, requirements, BPM or documents, the correct and most current version must be tracked and accessible. The team also creates a contingency plan for restoring the environment to the former configuration should the deployment to production cause unexpected and significant problems.

children.name: Manage Policies and Procedures
children.description: Any policies or business rules that need to change as a result of the initiative are formally developed and approved. In addition, create or modify standard operating procedures (SOP) for personnel to follow as part of the solution deployment and use.

children.name: Perform Solutions Testing
children.description: Execute the approach, scenarios, and steps to validate that the solution meets requirements and does not have significant problems. Identify, validate, rate and document any issues with the solution, tracking resolution for re-test.

children.name: Fix Defects
children.description: When code defects are detected, the programmer changes the code to resolve the issue, then checks the code back in with documentation.

children.name: Conduct Work Product Reviews/Demos
children.description: Conduct a session in which a document or system functionality is reviewed for completeness and accuracy.

children.name: Establish Infrastructures
children.description:
The architect insures that the needed architectural foundation is in place to support the solution. For software development, special hardware/software environments (at varying levels) may be needed for creating and checking the code (Development and Test Env) as well as the Production environment. There may be needed facilities, equipment, hardware/software, or other aspects of the solution needed to make it work effectively in production.
Could also be putting together or setting up (such as a computer system or equipment) by supplying, arranging, or connecting a specific set of internal or external components.

children.name: Develop Communication Plans
children.description: Identify the method, the schedule, and the audience for any written or verbal information about the solution.

children.name: Create Customer Support Plans
children.description: Develop a plan for customer support that may be required or change as a result of the solution.

children.name: Develop Training Plans
children.description: Identify who needs to be trained for the solution use, how to train them, the trainer(s) and the schedule.

children.name: Develop Training
children.description: Determine training type needed and create it based on the solution complexity.

children.name: Evaluate Security Compliance
children.description: InfoSec determines if there are any access and security issues that need to be addressed for the solution.

children.name: Conduct Location Impact Analysis and Planning
children.description: An engineer would determine the type and extent of changes needed to a facility to support a solution.

children.name: Deploy Solution
children.description: Manage solution release, deployment, and implementation.

children.name: Deployed Solution
children.description: Initiative(s) is/are successfully completed and in production (delivered) to close one or more capability gaps.

children.name: Updated Policy/Procedures
children.description: Solution can result in updated process steps/procedures as well as policy changes that must be deployed with the solution.

children.name: Certify Solutions
children.description: Provide documentation that the solution architecture complies the current architecture standards. (Meets Reference Architecture )

children.name: Conduct Software Builds
children.description: Compile the software code into a version that is complete for use in a test or production environment.

children.name: Approve Deployments
children.description: This is a go/no decision to provide the solution for consumption. This can be based on an evaluation of software functionality and any defects--the number, type and severity,

children.name: Enable Solution Accesses
children.description: Provide permissions/access to the solution based on id or role.

children.name: Implement Solutions To Production
children.description: The solution that is deployed into the company environment for use can be process or software.

children.name: Communicate Solution Changes
children.description: Could be to internal personnel and/or customers; what new functionality is, changes in process/procedures, where to get more information etc

children.name: Execute Post Load Checkouts
children.description: Once the solution is in place and being used, it's efficacy needs to be evaluated to make sure it is working as intended, or if it needs to be removed due to unexpected consequences or problem severity.

children.name: Identify Production Issues
children.description: Identify and manage any defects (known or unknown at launch) that are evident in the production environment.

children.name: Conduct Field Tests
children.description: Implement a limited roll-out to certain locations/markets/regions to determine if the functionality works as expected and is well-received. Feedback can be gathered to improve the solution. After an alpha test, a secondary test may be desired in a limited market/locations to further prove the solution is viable.

children.name: Train Personnel
children.description: Training could be classroom, virtual/online, a job aid, or verbal instruction for human resources internal to company and/or customers for the solution.

children.name: Evaluate/Measure Solution Effectiveness
children.description: When the solution has been implemented, the identified measurements are taken to determine if the expected benefit is being achieved by the company.

name: Deploy Product
description: Create a viable product that meets a well-defined customer, market, gap, or regulatory need.

children.name: Define Product Concept
children.description:
Ideate and conceptualize solutions for identified needs or gaps for internal 
and/or external stakeholders.

children.name: Request for new product or product improvement.
A defined product concept that meets the customer need.
Defined And Understood Product Concept
children.description: The product concept defined and understood.

children.name: Ideate Product Concept
children.description: Identify a product idea to solve an customer problem or business scenario, or support a strategic or regulatory request.

children.name: Align to Strategy
children.description: Validate the product idea against corporate and/or portfolio strategy to ensure alignment and fulfillment of a business objective.

children.name: Perform Product Research
children.description: Collect customer or market data to better understand the market needs and conditions related to product ideation, including Voice of Customer and competitive analysis.

children.name: Update Product Concept
children.description: Update the product concept against business rules and feedback, then gain stakeholder approval.

children.name: Evaluate Product Feasibility
children.description: Measure the level of interest, determine if the product is achievable and objectively gauge the productâ€™s potential for profitability.

children.name: Product Approval Approved for Design Approved for Resources Business Justification (define)
Feasible Product Concept
children.description: The offering is feasible (e.g., financial, technical, operational (people/process)).

children.name: Assess Product Feasibility
children.description: Evaluate the operational, financial, regulatory, and technical impacts of supporting the new product, including potential risks associated with the product.  This would include assessing the new product's impacts to existing products.

children.name: Test Product Concept
children.description: Plan and execute an initial test of the concept in real world market conditions and analyze the results to identify adjustments to product direction, scope, pricing and operational support.  May result in an updated prototype and market reassessment.

children.name: Build Product Business Case
children.description: Document the financial justification for the initiative and gain approval from the officers and other stakeholders. This generally includes documenting cost estimates, expected revenue, market share gain, profit gain, prevention of lost market share based on the implementation of the product.

children.name: Prioritize Product in the Portfolio
children.description: Obtain formal approval and prioritization from officers, governing stakeholders and/or process owners for the initiative to move to the next stage of work.

children.name: Finalize Product Concept
children.description: Finalize the product concept against additional research and stakeholder feedback. This results in a feasible product concept that is approved to move forward to design.

children.name: Design Product
children.description: Complete product design, identify required resources, and prepare plan for development (build).

children.name: Resource Plan: Development Plan: Detailed Product Design;  Metrics
Product Plan
children.description: The product is planned (e.g. service options, product attributes, communication plan).

children.name: Product Operating Model
children.description: Visualization of how the product delivers value.

children.name: Design Product Attributes
children.description: Define the product availability, product conflicts, geographic availability, documentation requirements, onboarding or enablements required, as well as platforms to support the product.

children.name: Define Product Capabilities
children.description: Identify the gap in existing applications and interfaces required to support the new product; could be new data elements, controls at various levels e.g. account, country.

children.name: Define Product Operational Support
children.description: Determine how the product will be supported operationally, such as Sort rules, modes of transport allowed with the product, restrictions on locations handling the product, in transit intervention or redirect rules, operational scans or instructions that should be applied to the product, etc.

children.name: Define Retail Product Support
children.description: Document the requirements in Retail Services, from product availability, procedures, maintenance, impact to inventory management and visibility.

children.name: Create the Sales and Pricing Plan
children.description: Determine how the product will be sold and how the discounting and pricing for the product will be supported.

children.name: Define Rating and Invoicing Plan
children.description: Document the Rate and Rate quote guidelines and rules for the new product, as well as any impact to the invoice.

children.name: Complete IT Product Architecture Plan
children.description: Document and communicate the high level design of the product, including capability gaps, interfaces and data stores; cross platform and possibly cross OpCo collaboration to ensure the product is supported across the IT enterprise.

children.name: Identify Product Resources
children.description: Determine the vendors, contractors and business teams required to build and / or configure the new product.

children.name: Update Product Design
children.description: Update the product concept against current business rules, based on feedback, resourcing and funding then ensure stakeholders are in agreement with changes.

children.name: Design Product Analytics
children.description: Define the parameters by which the product will be measured, the mechanism to measure the product, and how the metrics will be communicated.

children.name: Secure Product Design Resources
children.description: Communicate with requestor and FedEx teams to obtain necessary resources to design the recommended solution.

children.name: Develop Product Training Plan
children.description: Create a training plan and schedule for human resources to implement the product.

children.name: Identify Product Operations Infrastructure
children.description: Identify any needed line haul, operation, asset, or facility changes needed to support Pick up, Transport, Scanning, Transfers, Tender, and Delivery for the product.

children.name: Build Product
children.description: Develop a product that meets the needs defined in the Product Plan and Operating Model.

children.name: Approved product design; Required resources identified
Finished Product
children.description: The product is finished (e.g. Product support in place, Operations Ready).

children.name: Develop Product Plan
children.description: Create the plan, including the schedule, for development of the product. This includes identifying dependencies, risks, and resources necessary to execute.

children.name: Secure Product Build Resources
children.description: Communicate with requestor and FedEx teams to obtain necessary resources to build the recommended Product solution.

children.name: Develop Product
children.description: Develop product functional capabilities based on design.

children.name: Configure Product
children.description: Some aspects of a product may be configurable, so these changes will need to be performed in support of the build, i.e. Policy Grid, LSSI.

children.name: Set Up Product Pricing
children.description: Apply list pricing and any applicable discounts to products, and applicability of money back guarantee. This might require development work.

children.name: Set up Product Rating and Invoicing
children.description: Set up consuming of pricing and order info for a rate quote and rating for invoicing support.

children.name: Set Up Product Settlement
children.description: Set up rules for settling a product claim, or closing out an invoice. Includes configuration of a Legal Entity in a country for accounting purposes.

children.name: Build Product Analytics Mechanism
children.description: Create means for analyzing product performance and usage.

children.name: Validate Product
children.description: Plan and execute various types of testing - Unit tests, system tests, end-to-end tests and user acceptance testing. This includes planning, organizing, execution and analysis of the test results.

children.name: Develop Product Go to Market Plan
children.description: Work with Customer Service and Sales to define service level agreement for product in the market. Define Sales Compensation. Identify upgrade requirements for customers and customer targets. Define customer support and communication plans.

children.name: Train Human Resources
children.description: Train employees and or contractors who work with customers (customer service, and retail, for example) or who support the product operationally to be ready for deployment. This could include job aids, procedures, use of new assets etc.

children.name: Conduct Product Go/No Go Review
children.description: Gather information and conduct a session with the stakeholders to determine if the product is ready to deploy. A decision is made to proceed to production or not.

children.name: Deploy Product
children.description: Launch the product with the necessary support (e.g. training, advertising, communication, distribution channels, technical support and performance monitoring). The product is available to the customer.

children.name: Available Product
children.description: The product is available.

children.name: Develop Implementation Plan
children.description: Create the plan for the deployment and roll-out of the product, including communication to customers and stakeholders.

children.name: Launch Product
children.description: Enable product for a given market, channel, country, customer, or region. Move all the assets, software, policy grid, data etc to support the product to production environment.

children.name: Execute Go to Market Plan
children.description: Execute the Communication Plan, then respond to customer questions or concerns related to the new product. This includes calls to customer service, sales visits, customer integrator consultant visits, and pricing / rating questions.

children.name: Validate Product in Production
children.description: Conduct Alpha and beta testing in a production environment with select customers. Validate and update Product to resolve defects and issues before general offline release. Change management activities in this stage generally include making adjustments based on production defects and feedback received from customers, customer service, sales, competitive impacts, and operations.

children.name: Reconcile Product Funding
children.description: Release product resources, including human resources and funding, back to the pool. Evaluate initial funding versus final product cost.

children.name: Execute Contingency Plan
children.description: Back out or disable the Product changes from production due to significant issues, should the situation occur.

children.name: Measure Product Success
children.description: Measure and report on product performance and usage based on Product Analytics. Determine if product launch is successful.

children.name: Evaluate Product Roadmap
children.description: Based on product analytics and customer feedback, determine adjustments to product features, roll out plan, and general roadmap. Plan for future enhancements.

name: Develop Human Resource
description: The end-to-end perspective of developing an individual's performance, growth & learning, experience, and career advancement.

children.name: Evaluate Human Resource
children.description: The act of initiating the evaluation of a human resources, triggered either by the individual or management.

children.name: Career Goal
children.description: Career goals and opportunities identified.

children.name: Human Resource Assessment
children.description: Human resource performance and objectives evaluation.

children.name: Define Development Plan
children.description: The act of assessing the human resource's skills and abilities, identifying potential career opportunities, current position goals/objectives and/or defining development plans.

children.name: Career Plan
children.description: Development plan is ready, including the necessary steps to achieve goals and objectives.

children.name: Execute Development Plan
children.description: The act of supporting the human resource in execution of their development plan to meet desired goals.

children.name: Developed Human Resource
children.description: Skills and objectives achieved according to the development plan.

children.name: Transition Human Resource
children.description: The transition and acknowledgement of the human resource into the desired career position along with adjustment of compensation and rewards as needed.

children.name: Transitioned Human Resource
children.description: The Human Resource has transitioned according to the development plan.

name: Disseminate Information
description: The end-to-end perspective of requesting, creating, and delivering of information products to requester.

children.name: Establish Information Request
children.description:
The act of creating, validating and acknowledging Information Request through 
Appropriate channel

children.name: ??Communicated Information Request
children.description:
Information Request is documented and communicated to the parties who will act 
on it next

children.name: Criteria understood to fulfill Information Request
children.description:
All aspects of the information need are understood to generate an Information 
Request

children.name: Defined Information Requirement
children.description: Information Request is fully defined

children.name: Define Information Request
children.description:
Identify and document the Information Request, including objectives, goals, 
business value, platforms, tools, systems, policies, and security requirements

children.name: Identify Information Concepts
children.description: Identify Information Concepts needed to meet the business need

children.name: Identify Information Request Stakeholders
children.description:
Identify impacted stakeholders to understand their information needs and 
preferences. (e.g., recipients, audience -the intended users of requested 
information)

children.name: Create Information Request
children.description:
Act of providing required request information and submitting the request 
through FedEx authorized channel

children.name: Acknowledge Information Request
children.description:
Inform the requester that the submitted request has been accepted or denied 
with a Request/Order #).

children.name: Source Information
children.description: The act of identifying the sources of information required to fulfill the request.

children.name: Located Correct Information
children.description: Identified sources of information needed to fulfill the Information Request

children.name: Information Ready to Extract
children.description:
Information is fully understood and ready to be extracted from its source into 
the platform where further work will be done

children.name: Information Extraction Plan
children.description:
A plan for how the information will be extracted from its source has been 
created and is ready to be acted upon

children.name: Information Dissemination Plan
children.description:
A plan for how the information will be disseminated to the final recipients 
has been created and is ready to be acted upon

children.name: Information Retention Plan
children.description:
A plan for how to store and manage the sourced information in the platform has 
been created and ready to be acted upon

children.name: Identify Information Sources
children.description: Identify the source and location of Information needed to fulfill the Request.

children.name: Analyze Information
children.description:
Perform exploratory analysis on Information to identify the relevant 
characteristics of information

children.name: Frame and Profile Information
children.description:
Apply definition, metadata, and Information Profile to provide business 
context.

children.name: Plan Methods to Extract Information
children.description:
Choose information extraction methods, tools and techniques depending on the 
business needs for information extraction plan from one or multiple sources.

children.name: Develop Dissemination Plan
children.description:
Develop dissemination plan and channels addressing the scope, frequency to 
disseminate the information needed to fulfill the request

children.name: Determine Retention Requirements of Sourced Information
children.description:
Determine Information archiving, retention, and disposal timeline of sourced 
Information to remain compliant with organization policy

children.name: Process Information
children.description:
The act of creating the information product by extracting, transforming, 
loading, aggregating the sources of information as needed, as well as 
validating its quality.

children.name: Created Information
children.description:
New Information has been created by aggregating, transforming, and/or 
performing other operations on sourced information

children.name: Information Retention Plan
children.description:
A plan for how to store and manage the processed information in the platform 
has been created and ready to be acted upon

children.name: Acquire Information
children.description:
Collect and capture raw Information from identified sources to a centralized 
location for further processing as per extraction plan

children.name: Aggregate Information
children.description:
Merge Information from multiple sources to create a new Information with an 
understandable format

children.name: Transform Information
children.description:
Cleanse Information, apply business logic, assumptions, filtering, etc. to 
make Information accurate and consistent to better fit the business needs

children.name: Validate Information
children.description: Validate Information to determine its accuracy, reliability, and timeliness

children.name: Stage Information
children.description: Transport and insert the transformed information to a staging location

children.name: Determine Retention Requirements of Processed Information
children.description:
Determine Information archiving, retention, and disposal timeline of processed 
Information to remain compliant with organization policy.

children.name: Package Information
children.description: The act of organizing, compressing and bundling information for consumption

children.name: Packaged Information
children.description:
Information has been packaged to a point where it is ready to be delivered to 
the Information recipient

children.name: Organize Information
children.description:
Organize, format and visualize information to meet the needs of the requester. 
Develop Dashboards, charts, and other visual reports to effectively Disseminate 
the Information to recipients

children.name: Compress Information
children.description:
Reduce the size of the Information depending on the type and size to optimize 
Information transmission time, minimize storage capacity, etc.

children.name: Bundle Information
children.description:
Assemble Information addressing the request in a form acceptable by the 
requester

children.name: Deliver Information
children.description:
The act of delivering Information to the requester and fulfilling the 
Information Request

children.name: Delivered Information
children.description: Information has been delivered to the recipient through an accepted channel

children.name: Fulfilled Information Request
children.description:
Information Request has been satisfactorily fulfulled as determined by the 
Information Requester

children.name: Certify and Communicate Information Readiness
children.description: Ensure packaged Information is ready for dissemination and notify stakeholder

children.name: Deploy Information to Recipients
children.description: Distribute Information to target audience directly or through a third party

children.name: Enable Information Access
children.description:
Provide Recipient access permissions and tools, e.g. an API, link, attachment, 
or written/ verbal explanation.

children.name: Evaluate/Measure Information Dissemination Effectiveness
children.description: Provide a feedback mechanism to assess the effectiveness on dissemination

children.name: Establish Quality Compliance Protocol
children.description:
Provide overall plan for regularly monitoring the integrity and validity of 
disseminated information

name: Establish Account
description: A way of initiating and maintaining a FedEx Account to receive benefits, or conduct business.

children.name: Submit Account Request
children.description: The act of providing information to FedEx through any access channel for creating a new account or updating an existing account.

children.name: Received Account Request
children.description: FedEx has received the account request through a valid access channel and may or may not send a confirmation to the requester.

children.name: Identify Account Need
children.description: Applicant determines what the account need is with the business entity--a new account or an update to an existing account.

children.name: Create Account Request
children.description: The requester completes the process for requesting a new account or an update to an existing account, then submits it. (Currently requires a credit card on FedEx.com for a new account). This could also be done by Sales on the customer's behalf for larger accounts, or by a customer sales representative if the customer calls in.

children.name: Review Account Request
children.description: This involves reviewing the submitted account request, verifying the customer, human resource, or partner is qualified (eligible, authenticated, authorized) and determining the information provided is accurate and complete. This could involve employment, background, or credit checks (For example: a credit card is required to create a FedEx shipping account).

children.name: Approved Account Request
children.description: The account request has been evaluated, confirmed, and approved for Implementation.

children.name: Validate Account Request
children.description: If an existing account, review information against request to determine if the update can be made, and determine if request is complete and accurate, or if additional information is needed.

children.name: Verify Requester
children.description: The person requesting an new account or update is verified to make sure that the request is not fraudulent.

children.name: Conduct Credit Check
children.description: Determine the credit score and/or history of the person applying for an account, or validate a credit card.

children.name: Determine Workflow
children.description: Identify the next steps for the account request, depending on the type of request it is, and the outcome of the previous activities.

children.name: Establish Account Agreement
children.description: Provides the ability to apply standard or custom agreement terms, such as pricing where applicable, to an account or evaluate a customer, partner or human resource to determine if special terms and/or discounts could be applied as part of a custom agreement, based on the account type and expected volume of business.

children.name: Account Agreement
children.description: The account has an agreement for products with associated pricing and any discounts based on volume.

children.name: Evaluate Requester Product Need
children.description: Identify if the account requester has specific shipping needs based on origin/destination, product, commodity and special services. This would typically be a Salesperson activity.

children.name: Research Customer
children.description: Investigate historic volume for the customer, bill payment status and other relevant information to determine any discounts or agreement terms.

children.name: Establish Account Agreement
children.description: Determine if this account will be linked to an existing account or is a new one (New account for an existing customer will be part of existing agreement). If a new customer or customer wants something different, a new agreement is created (can be by country, by zone i.e. US export, what product, packaging and/or services they want).

children.name: Establish Account Pricing
children.description: Determine if this account is linked to an existing account or a new one (new account for an existing customer will get auto-linked to a hierarchy and inherit that pricing). If a new shipping account, determine the account product pricing, rates, discounts etc based on shipment volume and origin/destination or region, defined as part of the agreement. Retail account discounts are based on the product, volume, history etc. Standard discounts may apply as a default, depending on the type of account.

children.name: Set Up Account
children.description: Applying appropriate preferences, access, privileges, pricing and payment terms, then recording information to prepare the account for use. This includes notifying any stakeholders, including the requester, that the account is available and activated.

children.name: Activated Or Updated Account
children.description: The account is updated to an active status and the related benefits are updated.

children.name: Rewards Program Enrollment
children.description: The shipping customer is enrolled into the FedEx Rewards program.

children.name: Account Confirmation Notification
children.description: Account activation or update messages are sent to the requester and any stakeholders, including changes to benefits, terms, preferences, account status etc.

children.name: Account Discount
children.description: Any standard or contracted discounts are associated to the account so that they are applied to future orders.

children.name: Set Account Preferences
children.description: Select preferences for an account such as notification types, display settings, billing options, configuration options etc

children.name: Set Account Pricing Hierarchy
children.description: If this account is linked to an existing account, it will get auto-linked to a hierarchy and inherit that pricing.  If a new shipping account, set up the account product pricing, rates, discounts etc in the system based on shipment volume and origin/destination or region so that it is applied when a shipment order is generated. Retail account discounts are based on the product, volume, history etc. Standard discounts may apply depending on the type of account.

children.name: Establish Account Information
children.description: Enter or update all account information needed, including name, address, contact phone number etc.

children.name: Provide Account Access
children.description: Set up a user id and password and any security related information (such as security questions for recovery, phone nbr for text pin etc) for access to the account.

children.name: Configure Account Permissions
children.description: Establish the level of information that may be accessed.

children.name: Enroll in Rewards Program
children.description: If it is a shipping account, the customer could be enrolled in the FedEx Rewards program as part of the account creation process.

children.name: Configure Account Enablements & Shipping Exceptions
children.description: Set up account product enablements and shipping exceptions for an account.

children.name: Activate Account
children.description: Make the account available for immediate use.

children.name: Notify Stakeholders
children.description: Communicate the result of the account request in a message to the requester and any impacted stakeholders.

children.name: Link Accounts
children.description: If this account is linked to an existing account make sure the two are associated.

children.name: Close Inquiry
children.description: The inquiry is completed/executed so can be closed.

name: Establish Facility
description: Build, buy, lease, vacate, re-purpose or improve a facility (e.g. warehouse, station, ShipNGet, dropbox, hub, etc.) or business operation.

children.name: Identify Facility Need
children.description: Conceptualize solutions for identified needs to conduct, sustain, expand or enhance business operation.

children.name: Confirmed Facility Need
children.description: Facility need validated

children.name: Define Need
children.description: Provide the need for new facility, leasing, or repurpose the existing one for business purposes.  Request of a facility need providing the statement outlining the objective and goals with justification.

children.name: Evaluate Facility Feasibility
children.description: Perform financial and operational evaluation on the feasibility of facility request.

children.name: Identify Facility Gaps
children.description: Evaluate the current state of the facility, and determine gaps required to meet projected needs.

children.name: Evaluate Options
children.description: Determine the ideal location, type, products and operations conducted in the facility and size of the facility.  Determine whether to build, buy, lease, vacate or re-purpose.

children.name: Conceptual Design
children.description: Early phase of the design process (e.g. concept sketches and models)

children.name: Approved Specification
children.description: Requirements validated.

children.name: Cost Estimate
children.description: Financial Packet submitted for approval.

children.name: Draft Schedule
children.description: Initial Facility Plan.

children.name: Approval To Build
children.description: Permission to construct

children.name: Determined Location
children.description: Facility placement defined

children.name: Request For Proposal
children.description: A document sent to prospective partners as an invitation for bids

children.name: Create Facility Plan
children.description: Activities associated with creating a facility plan which may include activities, cost, location and build schedule for the options under consideration.

children.name: Create Compliance Plan
children.description: Activities associated with planning regulatory, legal, security (license, permit, certification) requirements.

children.name: Design Facility
children.description: The process of completing the blueprints, design layout and project timeline for the facility.

children.name: Cost Breakdown
children.description: Itemized material and labor amounts

children.name: Agreed Upon Design
children.description: Final Design accepted

children.name: Define Facility Requirements
children.description: Define parameters for request, implementation, design, and build out of a new facility or facility modification including submission method and approving stakeholders.

children.name: Create Facility Blueprint
children.description: Develop proposed architecture / engineering high level specs or facility layouts, plans, sections, evaluations, or copy of the existing building plan.

children.name: Obtain Commitment
children.description: Select and secure the 3rd party contracts and funding necessary to build or redesign the facility.

children.name: Facility Design Approved Bids Solicited Funding Requested
Secured Funding
children.description: Funds allocated.

children.name: Selected Contractor
children.description: Bids reviewed, vendor selected and contract signed, performance criteria agreed upon

children.name: Proposed Schedule
children.description: Agreed upon timeline

children.name: Define Agreement
children.description: Draft an agreement describing the purpose of the contract including all the responsible parties their work obligations and work rights.

children.name: Secure Funding
children.description: Obtain funding required for approved construction, lease, or repurpose.

children.name: Build Facility
children.description: Conduct the work necessary to build, equip or redesign the facility according  to the design and plans.

children.name: Facility Built Or Redesigned Inspections Complete
Schedule
children.description: Finalized timeline

children.name: Facility
children.description: Facility complete

children.name: Define Facility
children.description: The activities needed to describe, specify and identify facility.

children.name: Construct Facility
children.description: The physical construction and configuration of the building as per the plan and design specifications.

children.name: Obtain Compliance
children.description: Obtain/secure needed permits, License, Authorization, Certification,  to construct, alter, renovate, inspect, and maintain a facility in accordance with relevant regulatory codes and regulations.

children.name: Obtain Real Estate
children.description: Secure real estate via purchase, lease, or repurpose.

children.name: Open Facility
children.description: Make facility available to conduct business operations.

children.name: Facility Built Or Redesigned Inspections Complete
Activated Facility
children.description: Facility available for operations

children.name: Activate Facility
children.description: Make the facility available for use.

children.name: Communicate Facility Changes
children.description: Communicate the necessary facility updates to the stakeholders.

name: Establish Partnership
description:
Establish a partnership and the terms of an agreement with an external entity. 
Scenarios:
Vendor Partnerships:
Contracted Technical Services Vendor
Managed Technical Services Vendor
System Integrator
Boutique (Non-standard) Vendor

children.name: Identify Partnership Need
children.description: Define enterprise and/or partner requirements, needs, benefits, etc. for/from the potential partner relationship in a formal/informal manner. Evaluate and analyze needs to determine which type of partnership, if any, will best align with strategy and policy. Approve engagement with potential partners of the appropriate classification(s).

children.name: Requirement detailed; Requirement validated; Partner type(s) proposed.
Request For Proposal
children.description: Also known as RFP, this is where a business makes a request for proposals from potential partners. The business places a newspaper ad or makes a direct inquiry and in response the potential partner submits a formal proposal to complete the work/provide services under consideration.

children.name: Engagement Approval
children.description: Approval to proceed to the next step after standard evaluation procedures have been conducted

children.name: Select Partner
children.description: Select partner and establish interim engagement allowing planning, communication, negotiation, etc. to orderly and legally proceed.

children.name: Requirement detailed; Requirement validated; Partner type(s) proposed.
Identified Partner
children.description: Potential partner is identified and assessed according to vendor criteria, thus identifying the processes to follow thereafter.

children.name: Proposal
children.description: Provides summary of how requirements can be fulfilled by potential partner as well as the value of offering in terms of cost

children.name: Interim Agreement
children.description: Allows initial communication to proceed with potential partner.

children.name: Communication Channels
children.description: Methods and structure by which information regarding the potential partnership can be shared such as meetings, emails, etc.

children.name: Establish Agreement
children.description: Evaluate requirements, accept proposal, develop statement of work (SOW), negotiate agreements, receive legal an regulatory approvals, etc.

children.name: Scope defined; Terms defined; Partnership Approved
Roadmap
children.description: Timeline view of short term and long term plans for potential partner to deliver as well as key vendor management activities that must take place

children.name: Statement Of Work
children.description: Detailed list of how and when requirements will be met

children.name: Identified Sponsors
children.description: Management that maintains close focus on partner relationship to maximize benefit over time

children.name: Defined Metrics
children.description: Needed metrics for evaluation and progress are defined.

children.name: Legal Approval
children.description: Documented legal consent of agreement details so far and agreement to proceed to the next steps.

children.name: Regulatory Approval
children.description: Documented consent or authorization provided by a government agency or other regulating body, regarding status of partnership and ability to proceed to next steps.

children.name: Implement Partnership
children.description: Establish operational procedures, communication channels, software configuration(s), policies, etc.

children.name: Communication Channels
children.description: Methods and structure by which information will be shared within the partnership such as meetings, emails, etc.

children.name: Financial And Accounting Infrastructure
children.description: Methods and structure by which financial aspect of partnership is managed, including payment structure,  quarterly and annual reviews, etc.

children.name: Operating Model
children.description: Visual representation (model) of how an organization delivers value to its customers or beneficiaries.

children.name: Regulatory Filing And Reporting
children.description: A document that a company has to send to an official organization that regulates its activities

children.name: Operational Infrastructure
children.description: Framework and management of essential operation components, such as policies, processes, equipment, data, human resources, and external contacts, for overall effectiveness

name: Establish Policy
description: Define and implement policy.

children.name: Assess Need
children.description: Understand the need and determine the necessity for it (e.g. Guidelines, procedures, etc.)

children.name: Criteria Understood To Define New Policy
children.description: Analysis performed to meet the need.

children.name: Determine Policy Need
children.description:
Provide a clear need for new Policy or revision of an existing policy with a 
clear understanding of a problem to solve.

children.name: Identify Policy Gap
children.description:
Evaluate the current state of policy, and determine gaps required to meet 
determined needs.

children.name: Evaluate Policy Feasibility
children.description:
Perform financial and operational evaluation on the feasibility of policy 
request (needed resources available).

children.name: Identify Stakeholder
children.description: Identify impacted stakeholders.

children.name: Define Policy
children.description: Identify policy requirements either through legislation research or business policy creation to determine what we need to do to manage and control new polices and regulations. Engage key stakeholders in policy definition. Establish ownership in general (e.g. by OPCO).

children.name: Defined Policy
children.description: A definite course/method of action selected to guide and determine the general goals and acceptable procedures utilized to make decisions.

children.name: Compliance Program
children.description: Agreement on means to achieve compliance and/or corrective actions  to resolve violations.

children.name: Determine Policy Requirements
children.description: Determine policy requirements to set the policy scope, type and review cycle.

children.name: Define Compliance Control
children.description: Analyze compliance requirements to define controls.

children.name: Draft Policy
children.description:
Document policy in clear concise and unambiguous language and formatted so as 
to be easily readable which includes any modifications from existing policy.

children.name: Approve Policy
children.description: The official review and authorization to establish the creation or modification of a policy.

children.name: Approved Policy
children.description: Approval obtained for the policy.

children.name: Conduct Policy Review
children.description: Review policy draft with appropriate stakeholders.

children.name: Finalize Policy
children.description: Finalize the policy that is ready to go for final approval.

children.name: Obtain Final Approval
children.description: Receive policy final approval.

children.name: Implement Policy
children.description: Implement people, process, and technology changes, and required training and communication to enable the predefined policy controls.

children.name: Established Policy
children.description: Policy is active and in effect.

children.name: Policy Implementation Plan
children.description: Document utilized to define the implementation strategy. It outlines the resources, assumptions, short and long-term outcomes, roles, responsibilities and budget.

children.name: Prepare Policy Implementation Plan
children.description:
Establish policy communication, training and monitoring plan (include review 
cycle here).

children.name: Communicate  Policy
children.description:
Communicate policy clearly to avoid ambiguity and the implementation plan to 
the impacted stakeholders (notice boards, email or letter, handbook...).

children.name: Develop Training
children.description:
Training may need to be conducted to ensure that organization personnel are 
fully informed and able to implement the policy.

children.name: Develop Monitoring Criteria
children.description: Establish criteria to evaluate policy implementation and effectiveness.

name: Establish Supply Chain
description: Enable the delivery of products to customers by optimizing the locations for operational activities, conveyances between locations, and product inventory levels. Includes initial development as well as ongoing maintenance of the network, operations and inventory.

children.name: Define Product Needs
children.description: Identify the product and network requirements for the new supply chain.

children.name: Supply Chain Requirements
children.description: Product list description w serial numbers and requirements, locations, service level, systems, and carriers etc

children.name: Define Customer Supply Chain Requirements
children.description: Meet with the customer and gather their requirements/needs for supply chain

children.name: Evaluate Customer's Current State for Supply Chain
children.description: Create baseline for customer's current supply chain state.

children.name: Design Supply Chain
children.description: Analyze transportation network to determine locations/facilities, routes and transportation (such as mode) needed to fulfill requirements and meet Service Level Agreement (SLA). Determine if there are any gaps. Develop the plan for the supply chain including locations (warehouses), assets, staffing and transportation network. Formulate value quantification. Perform site planning analysis and define functional requirements. Determine if new facility locations are needed, and if so, kick off acquisition of facilities, staff, equipment, systems etc. Identify if new or existing partners are needed to provide services.

children.name: Supply Chain Proposal Defined for customer; Value Quantified
Supply Chain Plan
children.description: Solution Document which includes warehouse location(s), equipment, pricing, shelf space plan, item master, provision bin locations, user access etc;. also includes IT solutions (order processing/warehouse management at a data center) and Operations Technology Solutions (automation within the warehouse) as well as the proposed schedule for implementation.

children.name: Analyze Customer Requirements Against Network
children.description: Based on the customer's requirements, look at the current state of facilities, services, and transportation network to identify how the requirements could be met or any gaps that would need to be filled.

children.name: Develop Supply Chain Plan
children.description: Put together a proposal for a supply chain for the customer to meet their requirements using internal assets and products and/or third parties.

children.name: Obtain Solution Commitment
children.description: Proposal team puts together a statement of work for the customer and vets it internally w Finance, Legal and Operations before presenting a proposal to the customer for agreement to implement.

children.name: Signed Statement of Work for Solution
children.description: Type of Agreement with the customer

children.name: Establish Supply Chain
children.description: Includes initial planning (inventory move plan, set-up workbook, timeline etc), set up (provisioning, warehouse space allocation, systems set up, transportation carrier(s) etc), facility validation, and procedure development to prepare for implementation/go live.

children.name: Supply Chain Ready for Implementation; Partner Agreement(s) Signed
Provisioned Supply Chain
children.description: Includes facilities, inventory, human resources, equipment, systems and supplies

children.name: Partner Agreement
children.description: Contract with an external business (i.e. vendor or partner) to provide services as part of the supply chain.

children.name: Deploy Supply Chain
children.description: Activate the Supply Chain into production. May include training, evaluation of performance and optimization of inventory levels.

children.name: Supply Chain network operations and systems are available
Deployed Supply Chain
children.description: Orders fulfilled per agreement

children.name: Available Product Inventory
children.description: Customer inventory is available in the warehouse for orders and replenished

name: Establish Transportation Network
description: The activities involved to develop and deploy a physical network that meets transportation needs. This includes staff, assets, facilities, operations and connections.

children.name: Evaluate Network Needs
children.description: Analyze the demand to expand or enhance the transportation network.

children.name: Transportation Network needs identified and evaluated.
Identified Network Needs
children.description: Network needs identified.

children.name: Evaluate Network Feasibility
children.description: Perform financial and operational evaluation on the feasibility of requested network changes.

children.name: Identify Network Gaps
children.description: Evaluate the current state of the network, and determine gaps required to meet projected needs

children.name: Plan Network
children.description: Develop and validate a plan to build and deploy the transportation network.

children.name: Transportation Network Plan
children.description: Transportation Network development, integration and deployment plans. Plans include regulatory requirements.

children.name: Defined Asset Requirements
children.description: The assets needed to meet demand flow are defined. This includes assets needed to support the lanes, facilities and operations.

children.name: Defined Facility Requirements
children.description: The optimal facility locations and requirements are defined to meet forecasted demand flow.

children.name: Defined Human Resource Requirements
children.description: The Human Resources needed to operate the various components of the Transportation Network are defined.

children.name: Defined Lane Requirements
children.description: The lanes are planned to meet the forecasted demand flow.

children.name: Transportation Network Definition
children.description: The lanes are planned to meet the forecasted demand flow.

children.name: Plan Nodes (Operations)
children.description:
All of the activities needed to plan the nodes (operations at rest) on the transportation network including the profiles detailing the purpose, volume and physical capacity and/or constraints, work capacity, asset types, HR types, and intended schedules for the nodes (operations).

This is defining the static (at rest) nodes of an transportation network that is based on networking operations together.  This is not an operational planning activity as detail operations planning happen in the Execute Operation Value Stream, rather this is defining the nodes that make up the overall network as an infrastructure asset.

children.name: Plan Arcs (Connections)
children.description:
All of the activities for defining the connection of scheduled operations (nodes) for defining the network.  This would include the volume capacities between the nodes, the types of conveyors (mode) for the connections, intended schedules, etc.  

The actual planning of product flows and conveyors to operate on the connections will be accomplished in Execute Operation Value Stream.

children.name: Plan Facility
children.description: All of the activities needed to plan the physical Facilities needed to support Package handling operations and locations on the network

children.name: Plan Conveyor
children.description: All of the activities needed to plan the conveyors that will be needed to operate the network.  This would include allocation of conveyors and identification of additional conveyors for purchase or leas.  This includes Trucks, Vans, Aircraft, Tugs, Belts, etc.

children.name: Plan Human Resource
children.description: All of the activities needed to plan the Human Resources that will be needed to operate the network.  This would include number of handlers, conveyor operators, etc

children.name: Build Network
children.description: Develop an updated Transportation Network that meets the forecast and capacity needs defined in the Network Plan.

children.name: Efficient Network Infrastructure
children.description: The Network infrastructure is built per the Network Plan.

children.name: Asset Changes
children.description: The assets needed to support the Network needs have been acquired and are ready for use.

children.name: Human Resource Changes
children.description: The Staff is sized correctly to meet demand flow.

children.name: Facility Updates
children.description: Facilities are added, closed and/or updated.

children.name: Met Regulatory Requirements
children.description: The agreements needed to comply with regulations and policy are in place. (i.e landing rights, customs agreements etc.)

children.name: Establish Nodes
children.description: All of the activities for establishing nodes including node definitions required in a transportation network.

children.name: Establish Arcs
children.description: The activities needed to define and build arcs in a transportation network.

children.name: Define Network
children.description: The activities needed to describe, quantify and identify a Transportation Network.

children.name: Define Operation
children.description: The activities needed to describe, quantify and identify Transportation Network Operations.

children.name: Define Work
children.description:
Activities associated with creating, maintaining, and configuring work items 
and work requirements that will be performed by Operations. This includes 
catalogs of work items, characteristics of the work items, work item 
relationships, etc.
This activity is leveraged when identifying what work will be needed to be 
completed within an operation. It is evaluated and at least audited once per 
year and supports the operation and facility standards process.

children.name: Acquire Assets
children.description: All of the activities for associating required conveyors, facilities, equipment etc. to a transportation network.

children.name: Acquire Human Resources
children.description: All of the activities for associating required human resources to a Transportation Network.

children.name: Deploy Network
children.description: Identified changes are made to the Transportation Network and communicated to the stakeholders.

children.name: Transportation Network changes established and provisioned.
Transportation Network
children.description: The network has been modified to meet transportation needs, customer service expectations, safety requirements, regulatory requirements, and be cost effective as possible.

children.name: Communicate Network Change
children.description: The network infrastructure is validated and available to the stakeholders.

children.name: Activate Network Changes
children.description: Make the transportation network changes available for use.

name: Execute Campaign
description:
Outreach activity that targets a specific population, for example customers, human resources, partners, to achieve a certain goal, such as marketing and health awareness, advocacy and awareness, brand loyalty, hiring activities to reduce cost and increase revenue. Increase membership, engagement and retention of customers. 
    
The end-to end perspective of executing a campaign, from identifying the need for a campaign, to planning, designing, implementing and measuring the effectiveness of the campaign.

children.name: Propose Campaign
children.description: The act of submitting a proposal for a campaign (new or enhancement)

children.name: Acknowleged Campaign Request
children.description: Campaign proposal recognized by authority as a planned set of activities granted to move forward over a period of time in order to achieve a goal.

children.name: Plan Campaign
children.description: The act of defining campaign plan, including campaign targets and message, design, delivery channels, include testing with specific customers, implementation schedule, success criteria and required campaign budget and resources.

children.name: Defined Campaign Plan
children.description: Campaign goal identified that aligns with overall marketing strategy. The target audience defined with budget approval, resources and timeline to implement.

children.name: Implement Campaign
children.description: The act of delivering campaign content as planned

children.name: Delivered Message
children.description: Campaign message has been delivered to the targeted recipients as planned.

children.name: Close Campaign
children.description: The act of completing documentation (e.g. reports, submit invoices, make payments, communicate status), and measuring the effectiveness of the campaign for future execution and optimizations.

children.name: Captured Campaign Results
children.description: Campaign Plan is executed and ended. Campaign completed and results documented and disseminated to stakeholders to identify areas of improvement for future plans.

name: Execute Conveyance
description:
The movement of a provisioned conveyor along a planned route. 

Conveyance can be a combination of assets (trailer(s) w tractor, locomotive w train cars) or a single asset such as an airplane or van that has a unique id and schedule that moves from one location to another through a planned route.

children.name: Plan Conveyance
children.description: Creating a trip with associated itineraries, establishing and assigning the conveyor type and asset, defining the provisioning requirements (operator type, additional assets needed, initial itinerary schedule, fuel needed, sort operation, etc.), and creating a  conveyance plan when applicable.

children.name: Conveyance Plan is complete and available for execution.
Conveyance Plan
children.description: All of the requirements for provisioning a conveyor and executing the planned conveyance trip have been defined.

children.name: Established Conveyance
children.description: A Trip with waypoints has been established for the conveyor.

children.name: Create Conveyance Plan
children.description: This would include the activities associated with planning the assets, resources, fuel, catering, and other items needed to provision and carry out the conveyor trip.

children.name: Create Conveyance Work Plan
children.description: This would include the activities associated with planning provisioning and waypoints and associated work that will be required to carry out the conveyance plan.   This would include planning the beginning and ending, as well as intermediate waypoints required for successful operation of the conveyance.  This will include planned waypoints for fueling, inspections, breaks, meals, etc...

children.name: Prepare to Depart Waypoint
children.description: This stage describes the activities and tasks leading up to departure including  provisioning of fuel, food, personnel, assets, supplies and loading and unloading the conveyor as planned or needed.

children.name: Conveyance requestedConveyor availableConveyor at origin or interim waypoint.
Waypoint activities complete according to the conveyance plan or conveyance needconveyor departed waypoint.
Provisioned Conveyance
children.description: The conveyor (asset) and conveyor trip is provisioned for movement.

children.name: Properly Loaded Conveyor
children.description: The payload is loaded/unloaded on the conveyor and is available for transport to the next waypoint on the conveyor trip.

children.name: Load Manifest
children.description: A manifest detailing the contents being moved by the Conveyor is produced and available
