children.name: Approved Movement
children.description: Conveyor is approved for movement by operations and regulatory agencies as necessary

children.name: Enact Conveyance Plan
children.description: All of the activities for selecting and executing a conveyance plan.  This would include evaluating plan to use, creating a corresponding trip to execute,  and communicating the selected plan to run the conveyance.

children.name: Modify Conveyance
children.description: These are all the activities that allow the conveyance operator to modify the trip.  This would include operator initiated addition of waypoints, changing itinerary order, addition of work, and changing provisioning needs of the trip.

children.name: Provision Conveyor Trip
children.description: All of the activities associated with provisioning the conveyor trip for success.  This will include items like loading fueling/energy, catering, resources to operate the trip, assets needed for the trip, supplies needed, de-ice, etc.

children.name: Validate Readiness
children.description: Validation activities to ensure that the trip complies with safety, regulatory, and policy requirements.  This would include things like tire pressure, fuel levels, checking certifications, and other checks as needed.  This also includes validating that the conveyor trip plan is being followed.

children.name: Execute Waypoint Operation
children.description:
This activity is the execution of the tasks planned for the waypoint/stop.  These are the task to be carried out by the operator of the conveyor trip and providing the responses to the tasks.  This would include fueling, taking lunch and breaks.

Note:  In the case of a courier he/she is participating in two roles; one role as an operator of a conveyance and one role as a package handler.  In the case of a conveyance operator and conveyance work is performed under that role and for the execute conveyance value stream.  In the role of a handler they are operating under the Pickup and Deliver operation and are in the parallel value stream of execute operation.

children.name: Obtain Manifest Approval (Combine with Permission to Depart)
children.description: Obtain regulatory carrier manifest approval (023 for ATA, HAWB for Express / Express Freight, etc.)

children.name: Screen Conveyance Content
children.description: All Activities associated with Screening of contents and paperwork to identify prohibited commodities, contents, and parties within the payload of the conveyor.  This would include inspections at a border crossing, weigh station, etc.

children.name: Obtain Permission To Depart Conveyor
children.description: Activities needed to depart a conveyor. Includes clearance requirements as well as internal permissions.

children.name: Communicate Itinerary
children.description: Itinerary is communicated.

children.name: Travel To Waypoint
children.description: This stage describes all activities from the moment of departure from an origin or interim waypoint to arriving at a destination waypoint, including navigation between the waypoints and final movement to a gate, dock, or parking position. This includes obtaining permission to arrive.

children.name: Conveyor has arrived at the next waypoint
Conveyance Progress
children.description: Conveyor is progressing through the conveyor trip.

children.name: Approved Arrival
children.description: Conveyor is approved for arrival by operations and regulatory agencies as necessary

children.name: Modify Conveyance
children.description: These are all the activities that allow the conveyance operator to modify the trip during the navigation of the conveyor to the next waypoint.  This would include operator initiated addition of waypoints, changing itinerary order, addition of work, and changing provisioning needs of the trip.  Examples would be emergency landings, unplanned fueling stop, equipment issues, etc.

children.name: Navigate Conveyor
children.description: All of the activities of operating and navigating the conveyor to the next waypoint on the trip.  This would include departure staging, taxiing, driving, flying, walking, etc...  This would include decision making to modify path like avoiding road conditions, weather, hazards, etc...

children.name: Obtain Arrival Permission
children.description: All of the activities to file and gain approval for arriving a conveyor at the next waypoint.  This would include regulatory admissibility approval, operational approval, and third party approval like permission to deliver.

children.name: Terminate Conveyance
children.description: This stage is the termination of an conveyor's trip and any activities needed to close out that trip.  This includes any operational steps for trip reconciliation and for securing the conveyor (asset) and for logging and communicating status of the conveyor (asset) and conveyor operator according to policy and regulations after a conveyor has moved to the final waypoint of the trip itinerary.

children.name: Conveyor arrived at final waypoint of the trip
Completed Conveyor Trip
children.description: Conveyance and personnel arrived at final destination.

children.name: Reconciled Conveyance
children.description: The trip details have been reviewed and accurately documented.

children.name: Available Conveyor
children.description: The conveyor is available for the next activity.

children.name: Terminated Trip
children.description: Trip terminated per policy and in accordance with regulatory agencies.

children.name: Complete Trip Log
children.description: All of the activities to complete operational and regulatory logs recording information about the trip.

children.name: Complete Post-Trip Conveyor Inspection
children.description: All of the activities required to inspect the conveyor, assets, and other resources used in the conveyance.

children.name: Reconcile Conveyor Trip
children.description: The activities associated with reconciling a conveyor trip after its completion.  This can include validation and modification of activities, waypoints, tasks, timing, etc.  This would include courier de-brief, contractor de-brief, and other detail activities needed to close out the trip.

name: Execute Operation
description: The evaluating, planning and execution of orchestrated tasks to achieve a desired outcome in a specified time period.

children.name: Plan Operation
children.description: Create the necessary plans to execute the operation.

children.name: Operationâ€™s plan is complete and available for execution Set Up Plan is complete and available.
Operation Plan
children.description: Operating Plan created and communicated to stakeholders, including personnel that would be assigned.

children.name: Set Up Plan
children.description: Set Up Plan created and communicated to stakeholders. This plan includes everything needed to properly provision the operation.

children.name: Plan Human Resources
children.description: Create a human resource staffing plan based on operation demands (labor and skills required).

children.name: Plan Assets
children.description: Create an asset allocation and usage plan based on operational demands (work). Create an asset allocation and usage plan based on operational demands (work). This level of planning involves balancing Assets across multiple operations.

children.name: Plan Network
children.description: Activities associated with planning the network configuration. This includes the plan for sort assignments, consolidation assignments (splits) etc, connections between sort operations (linehaul and sort).

children.name: Plan Work
children.description: Work Planning activities include assigning work to operations, assets and Human resources. This includes managing work order processing and routing. Work may also be outsourced to partners, venders etc. This activity includes creating and maintaining work items in a work item catalog for the operation.

children.name: Create Operating Plan
children.description:
Activities associated with creating operating plans. May include asset plan, 
staff plan, flow plan (sorts), load plans, trip plans etc. Asset planning - 
Plan the assets that will be required in order to successfully run an 
operation. This will include schedules for the assets, predicted locations of 
their need, and any unique asset requirements. Plan Staffing - Plan the staff 
needed to run a successful operation. This includes scheduling of the staff, 
identifying needed skills, and matching staff to work. Plan Sort Flows - 
Planning the handling unit flow through a sort operation including input/output 
assignments, consolidation assignments and rules, etc...
Create annual operation and facility standards. Used for annual goal setting 
and guiderails. Leverages Activities within the Establish Tranportation network 
VS extensively to establish the necessary inputs to frame up the future state 
of the network so that the standard calculations can be completed.

children.name: Create Trip Plan
children.description: All of the activities associate with evaluating and defining the needed conveyance capacity to level movement across the conveyance network.   This includes pickup and delivery, linehaul movements, conveyance movements within a sort operation, etc...

children.name: Plan Handling Unit Inventory Management
children.description: The activities associated with planning inventory storage space, locations, rules for Handling Units designated for movement.

children.name: Plan Regulatory Compliance
children.description: Obtain clearance licenses, approvals and permits needed to operate. Includes the plan for Declaration processing.

children.name: Manage Operational Profiles
children.description: Activities associated with defining and maintaining Operational Profiles that may contain constraints, attributes, averages etc. Operational Profiles are leveraged when creating an Operating Plan. Often profiles are leveraged by solvers to produce solutions or plans that support operations.

children.name: Prepare Operation
children.description: Set up the Operation, including people, assets and supplies needed to run the operation.

children.name: Operation Plan Available Set Up Plan Complete and available.
Provisioned Operation
children.description: Assets, Human resources and supplies assigned and ready for use to execute the operation.

children.name: Enact Operating Plan
children.description: All of the activities for selecting and executing an operations plan.  This would include evaluating plan to use and communicating the selected plan to run the operation such as staffing plans, asset plans, on-road plans, clearance plans, etc

children.name: Setup Work Area
children.description: All of the activities associated with preparing and provisioning the work areas prior to start  of the operation.

children.name: Distribute Assets
children.description: Position the assets at the places needed for the operation. This includes giving operations authorization and access to assets as well as assigning and moving assets between operations. This activity may be supported by the operation set up plan done in the first stage (Plan Operation Stage > Value Item - Set Up Plan).

children.name: Staff Operation
children.description: All the activities required to enable Human Resources to support the operation. Includes granting access and authorization to facilities, assets and operational information.

children.name: Define Trips
children.description: All the activities required to create (or remove), identify and quantify Trips for a transportation operation.

children.name: Run Operation
children.description: Execute the Operation Plan, starting and running the operation.

children.name: Operation Plan Complete Set Up Complete
Met Operational Objectives
children.description: The desired outcome is achieved per plan.

children.name: Coordinate Operation
children.description: Activities related to adjusting an operation to meet needs based on events like weather, traffic, delays unplanned work etc. Starting and stopping the operation. Includes monitoring of flows of packages, assets, and conveyances to adjust people and assets.

children.name: Adjust Network Configuration
children.description: All of the activities needed to adjust the configure the network (linehaul or sort) based on actual volume and flow.  This is adjusting the network plan during the running of the network to make micro adjustments to account for real time fluctuations in volume and circumstances.    This includes changing planned network configuration that will have an impact of how packages (HUs) will flow through network.

children.name: Coordinate Human Resources
children.description:
All of the activities needed to reposition HR Resources to other work and assets as needed to ensure work continuity.  

Note: Coordinate and modify the placement and assignment of People, assets (conveyors, equipment, etc), and work.

children.name: Coordinate Assets
children.description: All of the activities needed to keep assets refreshed to work areas to ensure work continuity.

children.name: Coordinate Regulatory Compliance
children.description:
Activities associated with submitting/filing import, export and transit declarations.
This activity now includes in-bond declarations (e.g., transit).

children.name: Perform Handling Unit Work
children.description: The activities associated with the handling of handling units.  This would include making and communicating itinerary to be followed/next load point, divert/sort decisions, weighing, x-raying, measuring, inspecting, and other handling activities associated with a sort operation.

children.name: Perform Non Handling Work
children.description: The activities associated with work for an operation that is not associated with handling units.  This would include sweeping floors, fueling, breaks, accounting, performance management, etc...

children.name: Coordinate Conveyor Trips
children.description: Orchestrate the management of trips through the assignment of handling units to trips, supporting addition of pickups to trips (dispatch), and adjusting other aspects of the trips during the operation.

children.name: Coordinate Handling Unit Trips
children.description: Modify the trips of handling units to balance the operation, recover from issues, and address other operational needs.

children.name: Manage Handling Unit Inventory
children.description: Activities associated with identifying and placing handling units into inventory, managing the status of the inventory, managing the release from inventory, and other dispositions associated with in-bond inventory management.  This includes damaged HUs, in-bond inventory, security inventory, warehousing inventory, cycle counts, auditing, etc.

children.name: Load Handling Units
children.description: All of the activities associated with loading a conveyor at a sort operation.  This includes staging the handling units, organizing the load order, following a load plan, validating load contents, applying regulatory and safety requirements, etc.

children.name: Coordinate Shipment
children.description:
Coordinating the establishment of Shipment Information, Shipment Units and Shipment Work Requirements in response to Shipment related Orders. Shipment Order fulfillment involves translating Shipment product offerings into normalized Work Requirements. This activity includes the movement of Shipments across Networks. Activities included but not limited to: 
â€¢ Establishing additional Work Requirements for in-flight Shipments in response to secondary Shipment Orders. E.g. Custom Delivery Options, Regulatory Screening. 
â€¢ Establishing Shipment Work Requirements in response to Operational Work Orders to support Policy and Procedures related to Shipments. E.g Inspect Package 
â€¢ Coordination of Shipments across Partners and relative Networks 
â€¢ Shipment movement type Work Requirements. E.g. Transport Shipment to Memphis for inspection, contain Shipment

children.name: Close Operation
children.description: Post execution activities such as notifications, compliance activities and managing operational information.

children.name: All administrative and post operation duties completed.
Captured Operation Results
children.description: Operating Plan is executed and stopped. Operation assessment is complete, results posted and identify improvement opportunities.

children.name: Met Regulatory Compliance
children.description: Operation executed in compliance with policy.

children.name: Evaluate Operation Performance
children.description: The key activities needed to determine how well an organization is meeting specification and objective levels. This includes evaluating the operation plan, preparing the operation and executing the operation.

children.name: Evaluate Operation Compliance (Safety, Security, Regulatory)
children.description: The activities associated with determining how well the operation followed safety, security legal and regulatory requirements. This includes policy compliance management.

children.name: Reconcile HR
children.description: All of the activities to account for and achieve final disposition of all Human Resources performing work and other activities during the running of the operation.  This includes post operation time keeping activities for Human Resources.

children.name: Reconcile Asset
children.description: All of the activities to account for and achieve final disposition and location of all assets used during the running of the operation.  This would include turning assigned assets in, inspecting condition, replacing to proper location, etc.

children.name: Reconcile Work
children.description: All of the activities to evaluate the post operation disposition of work carried out throughout the operation.  This includes validating that all work is complete, determining roll-over work for next operation, evaluating work performance, etc.

children.name: Reconcile Operation Plan
children.description: All of the activities needed to evaluate and reconcile operating plans.

name: Execute Supply Chain
description: Managing customer end to end supply chain including transportation and warehousing services. (The first 3 stages represent 'forward logistics' -flow of products from the factory to consumer include direct order fulfillment, hub services, pick and pack services and shipping. The last 3 stages represent 'reverse logistics'- recapturing the value of products, part, and materials from returns, recalls, refurbishment, repackaging for restock or resale, recycling and disposal).

children.name: Receive Product
children.description: When product arrives from the customer or partner for storage at a warehouse facility, personnel receive it and put it in a location for storage.

children.name: Advanced Shipment Notification received from Customer (Stock Transfer Order)
Stocked Product
children.description: Products received from a customer put away into storage locations.

children.name: Product Inventory Available For Sale
children.description: Is in right condition, level and at correct location to satisfy orders. Inventory is in a status that is not quarantined (e.g. on hold, damaged)

children.name: Perform Product Enhancement
children.description: Delivering value-add services for the customer to add value to a product.

children.name: Product is enhanced according to value added service requirements
Enhanced Product
children.description: Lower cost or increase value of a product.

children.name: Distribute Product
children.description: Fulfilling product orders and shipping the product for resale or use.

children.name: Sales order received from customer or wholesale distribution
Fulfilled Sales Order
children.description: Completed as per the order request

children.name: Shipped Product
children.description: Customer receives the product ordered from warehouse.

children.name: Receive Product Return
children.description: Accept, evaluate and process incoming product return.

children.name: Return Material Authorization received for product to be returned Returned product delivered
Identified Product Disposition
children.description: Determination made on how to handle the returned product (e.g. recycle, disposed, re-shelved)

children.name: Assess and Repair Product
children.description: Fulfill the customer's request per agreement (refurbish, repair)

children.name: Product ready for resale, resuse, or redeployment
children.description: Product has been processed according to the customer agreement.

children.name: Disposition Product
children.description: Product is available for use, storage or disposal.

children.name: Product assessed and/ or repaired as needed
Satisfied Customer
children.description: Customer's expectations have been met.

children.name: Closed Return Order
children.description: Product is appropriately dispositioned and inventory has been adjusted.

name: Hire Human Resource
description: Identifying, evaluating, selecting and hiring an person to fill a need within an organization.

children.name: Request Position
children.description: The act of submitting a recruitment requisition for an person to perform work for the organization.

children.name: Open Recruitment Requisition
children.description: Requisition is open and submitted for approval.

children.name: Validate Position
children.description: The act of verifying that the recruitment requisition's financial and business justification criteria are acceptable.

children.name: Open Position
children.description: Position is validated and open.

children.name: Source Applicants
children.description: The act of finding applicants who may qualify for the open position and validating their interest.

children.name: Potential Matches
children.description: Potential matches have been identified.

children.name: Evaluate Applicants
children.description: The act of assessing the potential applicants against the open position requirements and extending an offer to the most qualified individual.

children.name: Qualified Match
children.description: Qualified match identified and offer extended.

children.name: Finalize Acceptance
children.description: The act of negotiating the employment agreement terms and conditions.

children.name: Commitment From Applicant
children.description: Acceptance / rejection from individual received.

children.name: Onboard Human Resource
children.description: The act of bringing an applicant into the organization and providing necessary training and resources for them to effectively start contributing.

children.name: Available Human Resource for Work
children.description: Applicant is actively contributing to the organization.

name: Resolve Service Request
description: Engage with customers who need support through any access channel.

children.name: Establish Service Request
children.description: Identify customer, issue or inquiry and initiate service request through an available channel for resolution.

children.name: Valid Service Request Communicated For Action
children.description: The service request is sent to the appropriate resources for research.

children.name: Request Assistance
children.description: Customer contacts FedEx Customer Service via their preferred channel regarding an issue or to request a change (address, signature, pickup, etc.)

children.name: Capture Contact Information
children.description: Capture customer information such as name, address, email address or phone number along with preferred channel of communication.

children.name: Capture Shipment Information
children.description: Capture shipment information such as tracking number, shipper address, and recipient address.

children.name: Track Shipment
children.description: Shipment is tracked to obtain current status and determine if a service request (case) should/can be opened, and location(s) where assistance may be required to resolve the Service Request.

children.name: Create Service Request
children.description: FedEx Customer Service representative enters in the shipment information and details of the request from the customer.  Alternatively, Operations or Clearance events may trigger a service request to be opened to resolve issues with delivery, such as missing clearance paperwork or an incorrect recipient address.  Includes determining the type of service request based on the information provided, e.g. missing paperwork, lost package, etc.

children.name: Prioritize Service Request
children.description: FedEx representative assigns a priority value to the service request based on the issue/request, shipment contents, customer segmentation, etc.

children.name: Route Service Request
children.description: Service Request is routed to one or more functional/geographical teams based on the type of request and shipment information.

children.name: Establish Callback
children.description: Determine the duration, frequency, and communication channel to be used for providing updates to the customer.

children.name: Acknowledge Service Request
children.description: Inform the customer that the service request has been created and provide a reference to the issue (e.g. request/case #).

children.name: Research Service Request
children.description: Investigate, discover, analyze and identify possible solutions for the service request.

children.name: Service Request received by appropriate team(s) for research
Research completed and service request document updated to include findings.
Analysis Completed On Service Request
children.description: The investigation and research needed to identify and document possible solutions and the resources needed to deliver the solution are documented.

children.name: Assign Service Request
children.description: Service Request is assigned to one or more team members based on the type of issue, shipment information, and team member assignment logic.

children.name: Research Shipment
children.description: Shipment is researched to obtain Current, Past, and Future information about the shipment and its components.  This includes status, location(s) where assistance may be required to resolve the Service Request, locations of the shipment, work for the shipment, trip information, etc

children.name: Validate Service Request
children.description: Review information provided is sufficient and correct to resolve the request, and determine if action requested is possible based on operations and account.  (E.g. pickup time past cutoff or account restrictions on re-routing packages.)

children.name: Deny Service Request
children.description: Document the reasons for denial and inform the customer that the service requested cannot be completed.

children.name: Investigate Root Issues for Request
children.description: Perform research and analysis to determine the root cause of the issue, e.g weather delays, missed pickups, damaged packages.

children.name: Explore Solution Options
children.description: Review the request and research options for resolving the request.  Document solution options.

children.name: Update Service Request
children.description: Record actions and communications in the service request.

children.name: Resolve Service Request
children.description: Execute solutions and take action on the service request recorded to bring it to completion.

children.name: Action needed to resolve a documented and researched service request
Needed action is taken to resolve document and communicate request.
Resolved Service Request
children.description: The activities necessary to resolve the request have been completed.

children.name: Contact External Agency
children.description: Contact other agencies involved with the package movement, inspections, etc. E.g. Customs, FDA

children.name: Assign Service Request
children.description: Assign the request to one or more team members needed to resolve the service request.

children.name: Provide Missing Or Updated Documents Or Information
children.description: Provide missing or updated information, including address, documentation, phone number, etc.

children.name: Monitor Service Request
children.description: Monitor and update the service request based on callback and SLA.

children.name: Escalate Service Request
children.description: Escalate the service request  per approved policies. (E.g. if no response has been received from Operations within 24 hours for FedEx, or 1 hour for TNT)

children.name: Obtain Approval
children.description:
"Communicate with requestor and FedEx teams to obtain necessary approvals to execute the recommended solution.   
Examples:  
* Approval from management to expedite a late package on commercial aircraft.
* Shippers may request that a damaged package  either be returned or destroyed.
* Approval from Finance/Revenue organizations is needed to issue a refund/credit to the customer."

children.name: Execute Solution
children.description: Perform the agreed upon actions:  Includes items such as locating and expediting missing packages, rerouting packages, destroying or returning packages to shipper,  dispatch couriers, etc.

children.name: Update Service Request
children.description: Record actions, communications, and outcomes in the service request.  This would include updating the request if the recommended solution cannot be performed.

children.name: Request Shipment Intervention/Intercept
children.description: Submit a request to operations to intercept a shipment and perform screening or an intervention in response to customer or internal need.

children.name: Close Service Request
children.description: Conclude the service request by closing it and communicating the result to the stakeholders.

children.name: Service Request status is now documented communicated and closed.
Closed Service Request
children.description: No further action needs to be taken.

children.name: Communicated Outcome
children.description: Results of service request communicated to stakeholders

children.name: Notify Customer
children.description: FedEx team member notifies the customer of the final status via preferred channel(s).

children.name: Close Service Request
children.description: Update the status of the service request to indicate that no further action is required.  This may be done manually or automatically via an Operations event such as a POD scan.

children.name: Execute Satisfaction Survey
children.description: Request and document feedback on the handling of the service request.

name: Send Shipment
description: Preparing, initiating, monitoring and managing a shipment from origin to final destination.

children.name: Create Shipment
children.description: The activities involved in preparing goods and assets for transport, product selection, providing shipment characteristics, and making payment and tender arrangements in any available channel.

children.name: Goods ready for shipment and/or access channel engaged
Documentation (physical or digital) providedShipment terms acceptedShipment ready for carrier
Service Agreement
children.description: An agreement between the Customer or Partner with FedEx where one agrees to provide one or more services to the other.

children.name: Shipment Order
children.description: Request for goods or services for a shipment (e.g. packaging, service options, instructions, and pickup and delivery commitment per agreement).

children.name: Shipment Quote
children.description: An estimation of the cost of a particular shipment based on services, number of pieces, dimensions, weight, fees, duties, taxes etc.

children.name: Shipment Ready
children.description: Goods prepared for tendering to carrier.

children.name: Create Shipment Order
children.description: The activities needed to create and identify a request for shipment services.

children.name: Prepare Shipment Documentation
children.description: The activities needed for the customer or their representative creating the necessary regulatory documentation to ensure that the shipment will meet needed requirements and flow unimpeded through the network.  This would include preparation of shipment import clearance declaration and dangerous goods paperwork.

children.name: Pre-Screen Shipment
children.description: Activities associated with Pre-Screening prohibited commodities and parties

children.name: Define Shipment
children.description: The activities needed to identify, describe and quantify a shipment and its attributes.

children.name: Shop Shipment Services
children.description:
Review and select shipping services to move and handle a shipment. This 
includes shopping for price, duration, handling options, etc.

children.name: Validate Customer Eligibility
children.description:
When creating special services shipments, the agent has to determine that the customer account is pre-approved and valid for special services. 
This also could apply to customers who have been identified as banned from shipping services due to bad credit, being in a watch group etc.

children.name: Schedule Pickup
children.description: Arrange (if needed) the pickup of the shipment unit(s) by the carrier.  This would include contacting the carrier to specify the time and place for the shipment pickup and would include the setting up of regular scheduled pick-ups.

children.name: Finalize Shipment
children.description: Shipment label or Bill of Lading is printed.

children.name: Prepare Shipment Unit(s)
children.description: The activities needed to physically prepare goods and assets for tendering.

children.name: Establish Shipment Customer Information
children.description:
The activities needed to create and identify customers as well as capturing 
customer information (e.g., name, address, contact information, preferences 
etc.). This key activity includes information about the customer related to 
clearance (e.g., licenses, permits etc.). The Customer can be the shipper, 
recipient, payer, or 3rd party involved in creating a Shipment.

children.name: Tender Shipment To Carrier
children.description: The act of transferring custodial control of the goods and assets from the Shipper to the Carrier (or agent of the Carrier) for transport.

children.name: Carrier Has Custodial Control Shipment Accepted Agreement Accepted
Accepted Shipment
children.description: The shipment is accepted by the carrier for transport per the agreement.

children.name: Accepted Agreement
children.description: This is where the terms of the agreement are validated and modified as needed.

children.name: Tender Shipment To Carrier
children.description: All of the detailed activities associated with the customer providing a shipment to the carrier.  This is transfer of custodial control of the shipment from the Shipper to the Carrier (or agent).   This would include validation of required paperwork and proper packaging.

children.name: Screen Shipment for Custodial Transfer
children.description: The physical screening of a Shipment as well as screening the Shipment documentation required to transfer custodial control of a Shipment to a carrier. This is the screening that must be done to accept a Shipment into a carrier network.

children.name: Transport Shipment
children.description: The entire shipment is moved to the final destination.

children.name: Carrier Has Custodial Control Shipment Accepted Agreement Accepted
Entire Shipment at Final Destination
children.description: All the pieces are at the final destination per the agreement.

children.name: Shipment Progress Visibility
children.description: Parties have access to information about the movement, location and estimated arrival date and time of the shipment.

children.name: Shipment Condition Visibility
children.description: Parties have access to information about the physical integrity of the Shipment during transport. i.e. temperature, damage etc.

children.name: Custodial Control Transferred To Recipient
children.description: Shipment released / custodial control transferred to recipient according to agreement.

children.name: Manage Shipment Order
children.description: Allow shipment initiator or its agents to modify the shipment order or the shipment agreement.

children.name: Manage Shipment Requirements
children.description: The activities associated with meeting Shipment Requirements that involve customer interaction. Includes notifications to customers, partners and brokers related to Shipments. Includes any requirements related to Shipments including but not limited to Regulatory Requirements.

children.name: Track Shipment
children.description: The activities that allow stakeholders to receive or retrieve information of the value stage.  These activity includes tracking, notifications, data transfer, etc that communicate status and facts about shipments that are moving through the transportation network.  This would include communicating the progress of the shipments planned and actual itinerary, work completed, and work pending.

children.name: Manage Delivery Options
children.description: The activities that allow the shipper, recipient, third party, or agent to modify and manage the various options that specify delivery (RTH, HAL, etc.)

children.name: Schedule Delivery
children.description: The activities that allow the carrier to arrange time and place of the delivery.  This includes gathering needed information to support communicating with parties.

children.name: Screen Shipment During Transport
children.description: The screening of a Shipment after it has been accepted into the FedEx network. Includes screening the physical Shipment as well as screening the information related to the Shipment (Shipment Information and Shipment Declarations) during transport. Information screening may be the result of physical screening. This screening is initiated by the customer or customer representative.

children.name: Deliver Shipment Unit(s)
children.description: The activities associated with delivering Shipment Units to the final destination and made available to the recipient. The final destination may be a FedEx Facility (e.g. Station, Locker etc.)

children.name: Close Shipment
children.description: The activities associated in performing and validating the instructions for the entire shipment per the orders/agreements being fulfilled.

children.name: Entire Shipment has been transported to the final destination.
Fulfilled Shipment Order
children.description: Fulfilled Shipment Order - the instructions in the order have been completed per policy.

children.name: Manage Regulatory Disputes And Fines (move to claim VS)
children.description: Manage shipment regulatory disputes and fines

children.name: Tender Shipment To Recipient
children.description: All of the detailed activities associated with the carrier providing a shipment to the recipients.  This is transfer of custodial control of the shipment from the Carrier to the recipient (or agent). This would include gathering signatures, collecting monies, etc.

name: Settle Account
description: Activities enabling the bi-directional exchange of payments and reconciliation of accounts between two parties.

children.name: Produce Settlement Notice
children.description: The act of creating a Settlement Notice. The settlement notice may include a description of goods and\or services, fines, fees, total charge, and terms.

children.name: Settlement Notice
children.description: Description of the account reconciliation.

children.name: Identify Invoice Contents
children.description:
"The tasks required to capture subset of product / service data for invoicing based on type of product or service including obtaining account balance.
Invoice information for billing prepared (BPM)"

children.name: Format Invoices
children.description: The tasks required to check customer billing preferences and produce invoice accordingly. (Banks requires different invoicing formats)

children.name: Submit Invoices
children.description: The activities required to determine the channel and distribute an invoice  (via electronic data interchange, web, EDI or hardcopy requirement )

children.name: Print Invoices
children.description: The tasks required to print an invoice including selecting printing methods / devices.

children.name: Calculate Charges
children.description: The tasks required to calculate all the necessary charges for the invoice including rates and taxes / duties including discounts.

children.name: Determine Invoice Types
children.description: The tasks required to determine what type of invoice to produce, this includes if it is printed invoice, FBO or EDI invoice.

children.name: Post to Account Receivables
children.description: The tasks required to notify account receivables about the invoice for collection.

children.name: Retrieve Account Billing Methods
children.description: The task required to determine how to bill, which includes pre-authorized credit card, bill to account, or wait for customer billing cycle.

children.name: Issue Settlement Notice
children.description: The act of sending or receiving a Settlement Notice.

children.name: Issued Settlement Notice
children.description: Recipient(s) have received the invoice. This may include official receipt or acknowledgement.

children.name: Reconcile Settlement Notice
children.description: Validate the accuracy of the information contained in the settlement notice which may include a description of goods or services, the total charge, and the terms.

children.name: Valid Settlement Notice
children.description: Statement of reconciliation deemed valid by Settlement Notice recipient.

children.name: Process Invoice Adjustment Claims
children.description: The tasks required to process all invoice adjustment claims including EDI/FBO (FedEx Billing Online), phone  , sales AE/PRS (Account Executive / Pricing Request System) and dot-com invoice adjustment claims.

children.name: Resolve Invoice Adjustments
children.description: The tasks required to Deny invoice adjustment, process rebill request, process duty and tax adjustment, re-rate transaction and complete credit/debit adjustment.

children.name: Reconcile Shipment Invoices
children.description: The tasks required to compare the calculated charge in AFI to the charges FedEx has received from the actual invoice.

children.name: Resolve Disputes
children.description: The tasks required to analyze product / service information to provide critical information that helps support dispute resolution.

children.name: Post Changes to Account Receivables
children.description: The tasks required to notify account receivables about the invoice for collection.

children.name: Acknowledge Invoice Claims
children.description: The tasks required to acknowledge a claim regarding an invoice.

children.name: Validate Invoices
children.description: The tasks required to validate the accuracy of the invoice.

children.name: Transfer Payment
children.description: Customer acknowledges and pays money owed and includes transfer of funds, reduction of balance or reduction of credit.

children.name: Received Payment
children.description: The payment is in the possession of the intended recipient (not necessarily payment in full).

children.name: Determine Payment Acceptance Methods
children.description: The tasks required to select the payment acceptance methods allowed (i.e. payment by fax, payment via calling customer service, payment by phone (IVR), payment through FedEx Billing Online, mobile pay/ wallet etc). Example: Determining that payments are allowed at FedEx Office to settle accounts.

children.name: Determine & Communicate Balances
children.description: The tasks required to obtain and provide the balance owed (may be the same as the invoice balance or include a balance forward). Example: FedEx Office cashier determining the amount owed for office supplies via the cash register; Courier determining the amount owed for the COD return via Powerpad device/shipping label

children.name: Accept Currency
children.description: The tasks required to authorize currency (i.e. cash, checks, cashier checks, money order) as a payment option. Example: Funding a cash register; operating plans to limit the amount of cash collected

children.name: Accept Electronic Payments
children.description: The tasks required to authorize electronic payments (i.e. credit cards, prepaid gift cards, debit card, banking information, bank transfers, Paypal) as payment options. Example: creating a billing website to capture credit card information for billing purposes, setting up a credit card machine at a FedEx Office location, creating procedures to handle fraudulent credit card uses.

children.name: Accept Pre-payments (Pre-Authorizations)
children.description: The tasks required to authorize prepaid shipments or AWBs (airway bills) as payment options.  Example: Accepting a bill able stamp to cover the transportation charges for a package.  Customers can pre-purchase shipments (like STAMPS), and charges for additional weight or service upgrade are collected when tendered to FedEx.

children.name: Collect Payments
children.description: The tasks required to obtain a payment for products (includes payments for physical items, transportation services, ancillary services,  duties and taxes, COD remittance, FTC). Example: Requesting the COD amount from the recipient upon delivery of a package.

children.name: Update Account
children.description: Post entries to general ledger.

children.name: Account Balances are Final and Ready to be Posted
Posted Entries
children.description: Entries posted to appropriate ledger item(s).

children.name: Obtain Payment Details
children.description: The tasks required to retrieve payments details and information.

children.name: Reconcile Payments to Accounts
children.description: The tasks required to match payment information to customer accounts.

children.name: Reconcile Refunds
children.description: The tasks required to update an account with a refund.

children.name: Update Account Balances
children.description: The tasks required to update the amount of money owed on accounts.

children.name: Notify Collections
children.description: The tasks required to transfer delinquent or past-due accounts to a collection agency (or the collections department) for full or partial recovery of the amount.

children.name: Fund Accounts
children.description: The tasks required to administer, add, or withdraw revenue to/from FedEx banking accounts managed by financial institutions.

children.name: Reconcile General Ledger Entries
children.description: The tasks required to close the accounting period and reconcile to the corporate general ledger.
